user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of lfs_deinit:
```c
static int lfs_deinit(lfs_t *lfs) {
    // free allocated memory
    if (!lfs->cfg->read_buffer) {
        lfs_free(lfs->rcache.buffer);
    }

    if (!lfs->cfg->prog_buffer) {
        lfs_free(lfs->pcache.buffer);
    }

    if (!lfs->cfg->lookahead_buffer) {
        lfs_free(lfs->lookahead.buffer);
    }

    return 0;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
if (!lfs->cfg->read_buffer) {
        lfs_free(lfs->rcache.buffer);
    }
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 2.1 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation. The condition if (!lfs->cfg->read_buffer) depends on a run-time value (lfs->cfg->read_buffer). The lfs_free call is reachable whenever read_buffer is NULL at run time. This fragment does not contain unreachable code. (It would only be unreachable if read_buffer were a compile-time constant that made the condition always false/true, which is not shown.)
